definition: (fig.) attractive and easy mark/source of steady profit/moneymaker/cash cow
fat/fertile/loose-fitting or large/to fertilize/to become rich by illegal means/fertilizer/manure

sentences.english: Little Sheep's chairman and founding shareholders would maintain their minority interests.
sentences.chinese: 小肥羊董事长和一些创始股东将保留少数股权。

sentences.english: Little Sheep does things differently beyond the menu.
sentences.chinese: 小肥羊与众不同的不仅仅是菜单。

sentences.english: Little Sheep has taken pains to assuage food-safety concerns.
sentences.chinese: 小肥羊尽力减轻顾客对食品安全的担心。

sentences.english: Down came a jumbuck to drink beside the billabong.
sentences.chinese: 跑来一只肥羊，低头喝水在池旁。

sentences.english: And when those who bore the ark of the LORD had gone six steps, he sacrificed an ox and a fattened animal.
sentences.chinese: 抬耶和华约柜的人走了六步，大卫就献牛与肥羊为祭。

sentences.english: Yum China: Little Sheep Getting Tangled in Trade Friction?
sentences.chinese: 百盛收购小肥羊案卷入中美贸易摩擦？

sentences.english: And it was so, that when they that bare the ark of the LORD had gone six paces, he sacrificed oxen and fatlings.
sentences.chinese: 抬耶和华约柜的人走了六步，大卫就献牛与肥羊为祭。

definition: to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
(of a livestock animal) plump and strong/well-fed
